MC: What does the EXPLAIN command in PostgreSQL do?

column3: Shows the physical database structure
Displays the query execution plan and cost estimates
Analyzes only the number of rows in a table
Automatically creates indexes for slow queries

MC: What is the main benefit of creating an index on a column?

column3: It speeds up data retrieval operations by reducing scan time
It compresses the data for faster loading
It prevents duplicate values from being inserted
It automatically enforces referential integrity

MC: What is the potential downside of having too many indexes on a table?

column3: The SELECT queries become slower
INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations become slower due to index maintenance
Indexes consume no additional disk space
PostgreSQL ignores extra indexes automatically

MC: What is the difference between a clustered and non-clustered index?

column3: A clustered index determines the physical order of rows in the table
A clustered index only applies to views
A non-clustered index can only be used on primary keys
There is no difference in PostgreSQL

MC: Which of the following commands shows both the execution plan and actual run times of a query?

column3: ANALYZE PLAN
EXPLAIN COST
SHOW PLAN
EXPLAIN ANALYZE

MC: What does a Sequential Scan" in an EXPLAIN plan indicate?"

column3: The database is scanning every row in the table
The query is using an existing index efficiently
The plan is invalid due to missing statistics
The optimizer is rewriting the query for parallelism
An index that includes foreign key columns only
An index that contains all columns needed by a query, avoiding a table lookup
A backup index used for failover systems
An index that is clustered automatically by PostgreSQL

MC: Why is batching multiple inserts often more efficient than single-row inserts?

column3: It uses fewer locks per transaction
It improves referential integrity
It reduces transaction overhead and network round trips
It disables triggers for better performance

MC: What is parameter sniffing in SQL query performance?

column3: When the optimizer caches a plan based on the first parameter values
When a query fails due to null parameters
When indexes are sniffed for corruption
When the database adjusts memory parameters automatically

MC: What is the primary goal of query optimization in PostgreSQL?

column3: To generate random query plans for testing
To increase memory usage for faster execution
To minimize execution cost and improve performance consistency
To automatically rewrite all SQL into procedural code
